main event: A bright, star-shaped object was observed moving across the sky much faster than Sputnik in Ann Arbor, Michigan on November 20, 1957.
interesting points: The object was the size of the sun and white in color.
The object faded out like a meteor, but was moving much faster than Sputnik.
The University of Michigan observatory director reported a similar sighting on the same night while looking for Sputnik II.
The observer initially thought the object could not be Sputnik due to its speed and trajectory.
witnesses: civilian observer, University of Michigan observatory director
